He jugado los tres BioShock con todo y DLC al hilo en estos dos meses, y este es por mucho el que más me ha gustado, tanto en jugabilidad como en historia.

1912, somos Booker Dewitt, un exagente de Pinkerton. Nos han contratado para rescatar a una chica de una teocrática y racista ciudad en las nubes llamada Columbia, así es, una ciudad en las nubes, ¿Qué la mantiene arriba? ¿Por qué existe? ¿Quién es la chica? ¿Esto tiene algo que ver con los demás BioShock? Descúbrelo en la campaña

Algunos elementos de la saga se mantienen, seguimos teniendo mejoras genéticas y diferentes armas mejorables, sin embargo, ya no contamos con diferentes tipos de munición para cada arma. Las mejoras genéticas pasivas ahora son diferentes piezas de ropa, como si de una armadura de un RPG se tratase. Tampoco contamos con un mapa y dile adiós a esa molesta flecha que te indica el camino a seguir. La mecánica del gancho aéreo implementada en esta entrega dota de diferentes métodos de sobrellevar un área, pues puedes eliminar enemigos en el suelo o en el aire.

Hazte de los DLC “Burial at Sea” y vuelve al Rapture que tanto extrañamos y aumenta el lore de la saga.

Sin duda, el mejor BioShock.

Sin mas por el momento… Juega BioShock, ¿quieres?

Jugabilidad - 10/10
Historia - 10/10
Música – 7/10 (Casi no te percatas de la música de la radio de Columbia)
Arte - 10/10
Diseño de Niveles - 10/10
Jefes - 9/10 (Creo que es el BioShock con mejores jefes)
Replay Value- 4/10 (Otro elemento a extrañar son los diferentes finales, aquí solo existe uno)
Excellent RPG
Awsome story I recommend

为了伊丽莎白
结局出来真的起鸡皮疙瘩了，完全没往这个方向思考过。蒸汽朋克的场景，空中城市哥伦比亚的震撼，压抑的时代背景，颇有讽刺意味的关于宗教的描写，架空的故事结合真实发生的伤膝河战争与义和团起义显得颇具魅力。海葬dlc与一代的接轨也令人震惊。
졍말 띵작입니다 아직 안하셨다면 빨리 이 게임 부터하세용

“天空之城哥伦比亚，这个阳光普照的童话乌托邦。
人们穿着华丽整洁的衣服在街上有说有笑，午后温暖的阳光仿佛让人忘记一切烦恼。”
但随着Booker的到来，这个安静祥和的天空之城却也如同主角的内心一步步走向崩溃。虽然它阳光普照外表光鲜，但却与它的先知Comstock一样，在光鲜的外表下，隐藏着许多不为人知的肮脏秘密。
除去某些因素，我觉得它是个不错的游戏，虽然我通关比较快，但是在这几个小时我依然迫切地想找到那个女孩，也很想带她一起去巴黎。  ————虽然一切未能如愿。

Excelente juego, una historia un poco confusa pero con un final exquisito.

BioShock Infinate, takes place during the year 1912. There is a science-fiction story that also contains elements of horror. This story resolves in and around Columbia; a fictional city state, oddly enough floating high above the United States of America. This Columbia is governed through unusual civics, resulting in extreme cases of beauty and atrocity.
The stories' protagonist, Booker DeWitt, is contracted to find Elizabeth in Columbia. Elizabeth is a young woman, who plays an integral role in this extraordinary place, where the impossible is possible.

The perspective on this world is displayed from the protagonist's own eyes. His mission starts off peaceful, but he must soon fend off hostilities to stay alive. This action-oriented play is comprised out of overcoming adversaries, searching the environment for supplies, and finding a way to a next area, which progresses the story.
If the protagonist dies, he looses some of his collected money, or he may restart from an earlier point in the story.
To stay alive, the protagonist may obtain a recharging shield that absorbs damage. The protagonist may also stay healthy by finding consumables, and by using weapons, such as firearms. Eventually the protagonist obtains powers beyond the natural laws of physics and reality.
To win, the protagonist must finish the story by completing it, and by finding a way through the world, and by defeating adversaries. The protagonist travels mostly on foot, and may sometimes latch onto a magnetic rails, that runs through the air, connecting different parts of an area. Soaring through the air via this rails, reminds of a roller-coaster ride.

Visually, BioShock Infinate looks artistic; featuring soft visuals, and colours and world objects gradient blend together, without becoming simplified or cartoonish. Lighting effects often cast a soothing glow or reflection on the environment, and rays of light gracefully shine through the environment. The setting is an unlikely place, which positively draws attention, in regard to how the environments are designed. Voice recordings may be found during play, that contain background stories, that offer a deeper understanding about the place. BioShock Infinate has a lengthy and expansive story, with lots of ideas, in an interactive world.
Weapons and powers have different effects on adversaries, and combat may show gruesome violence. Additional powers and weapons may be found later.
Following the story offers a cinematic experience, that alternates between action-oriented play, and periods of relative peace.
Another highlight worth mentioning, is the artificial intelligence of a companion character. This companion does not need protection, but points out points of interest in the world. The companion uses convincing facial expressions, and changes appearance the longer she accompanies the protagonist, and keeps conversation with the protagonist as well. This companion walks around on her own, but also follows the protagonist. This companion takes cover, and sometimes leads the way onward, or may run away, and also interacts with other characters, depending on what the protagonist does, or interacts with the world, and comments on the actions of the protagonist, or ongoing events. The companion may help the protagonist when the protagonist falls, and offers supplies during combat. The companion's stance towards the protagonist will change along the story.
Lastly, there is an expansion available, which offers a story in a different scenery, and connects this story, to the story of the original BioShock.


This sunlit image shows a surreal environment, and is an example of BioShock Infinate's many artfully crafted locales:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2232554395
This spoiler video shows play, where there is a high degree of cinematic craftsmanship, delivering an emotional experience:
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2228948330

Now i don't think the game is inherently bad. The gameplay is fun. Pretty decent for a fps 

But it's the story where it get's a big complicated, it really feels like midway through the game they switched direction and it feels like you're hoping from one thing to the next. 

Also the story is in Colombia a white supremacist religious city so at one point you imagine you're gonna side with the rebels,  But when the rebels ( people of color) actually fight back it ends up telling you  ' they were both the same' and it's like fighting facism you become a fascist yourself narrative and i dunno ut felt a bit   isssh for me especially what's going on nowadays. 

STILL the gameplay and graphics are nice good action games gameplay wise took me 10-11 hours to complete and got it on sale for 9 bucks so i don't regret it but i don't feel  accomplished either because of the weird story pace.

Pros:
-Very nice graphics.
-Bioshock settings are very interesting, it is neat to be in a city in the clouds.
-The abilities are interesting.

Cons:
-Story is very meh, not very memorable.
-Not the same atmosphere as the first two games which were more interesting.
-Shooting mechanics are somewhat dated at this point but overall fine.

Overall: The gameplay is pretty average with the abilities and graphics being the best parts. Not the same atmosphere as the first two but it is still an interesting environment to explore. I like the time graphics a lot in the game, it is very beautiful to look at the city of the clouds and the style of the characters and city are very memorable. Story is my main drawback though, I felt like they could have done a lot more for it.
